qas.question: What type of "off color" humor did Von Neumann especially enjoy?
What complaints did Von Neumann's neighbor's have?

answers.text: regularly playing extremely loud German march music

qas.question: What famous neighbor did Von Neumann have that may have been distracted by the music Von Neumann played?

context: Von Neumann liked to eat and drink; his wife, Klara, said that he could count everything except calories. He enjoyed Yiddish and "off-color" humor (especially <a0_0>limericks<a0_0/>). He was a non-smoker. At Princeton he received complaints for <a1_0>regularly playing extremely loud German march music<a1_0/> on his gramophone, which distracted those in neighbouring offices, including <a2_0>Albert Einstein,<a2_0/> from their work. Von Neumann did some of his best work blazingly fast in noisy, chaotic environments, and once admonished his wife for preparing a quiet study for him to work in. He never used it, preferring the couple's living room with its television playing loudly.
